title.rendered: Complaints about product prices can be made on the number ‘333’

content.rendered:
State Minister for Posts, Telecommunications and Information Technology Junaid Ahmed Palak at the exchange meeting on Monday at the Secretariat.

Any complaint regarding the price of the product can be reported by calling the government service number ‘333’.

State Minister for Posts, Telecommunications and Information Technology Junaid Ahmed Palak said in a discussion meeting at the Secretariat on Monday, “After the spread of the Covid epidemic in 2020, the use of 333 was increased to deliver food to the homes of poor people and to identify patients.

“Using that experience, an initiative has been taken to link the number 333 with commodity price control.”

The state minister said that the system of reporting complaints to 333 will be launched within this month.

On this occasion, an urgent discussion meeting was organized with stakeholders on ensuring more transparency in market rates and bringing innovative changes through digitization in this regard.

State Minister for Posts, Telecommunications and Information Technology Junaid Ahmed Palak at the exchange meeting on Monday at the Secretariat.

Representatives of TCB, National Directorate of Consumer Rights Protection, Shop Owners Association, Supershop Owners Association, various corporate groups of consumer goods were present in the meeting.

State Minister Palak said, “333 call centers are already active. A digit will be added there. There the consumer can complain about the price of goods from any market. A website will also be created, where the daily prices will be given.”

He said that the Prime Minister has given instructions in the Cabinet meeting to control the prices of goods in the upcoming fast.

He said, “Many problems will be solved if accurate data can be stored and exchanged among themselves at the production, storage, marketing, marketing and import stages of any product. We want to use technology to provide its real-time information to the Ministry of Commerce.”

State Minister for Posts, Telecommunications and Information Technology Junaid Ahmed Palak at the exchange meeting on Monday at the Secretariat.

“On the occasion of Ramadan, we will first open a call center. I want to add a digit to the current government information service 333. When everyone provides rice, sugar, potato, oil price information at one place, it will be easy to understand the price of any item in any district or where. If the price of any product falls too much, the administration can immediately go and buy all the products and sell them wherever needed,” said the state minister.
